A typical AI system consists of several components:
Data: The foundation for learning and accuracy.
Algorithms: The rules and logic of the system follow.
Model: The trained outcome that can make predictions or classifications.
Some common fields within AI include:
Machine Learning (ML): Enables machines to learn from data.
Natural Language Processing (NLP): Allows understanding of human language.
Computer Vision: Empowers machines to "see" and interpret images.
Robotics: Combines AI with physical systems.

Types of AI
Understanding these categories helps us grasp how far AI has come — and how far it can go.
Based on Capabilities
1.Narrow AI (Weak AI):
Designed to perform a specific task.
Examples include voice assistants, facial recognition, and recommendation systems.
This is the most commonly used form of AI today.
2.General AI (Strong AI):
A theoretical concept of an AI system that possesses human intelligence.
It can perform any intellectual task that a human can.
Still under research — not yet achieved.
3.Superintelligent AI:
Hypothetical future AI surpasses human intelligence.
Capable of outperforming humans in all aspects — reasoning, creativity, decision-making.
Raises ethical and existential concerns.
